intro: Catopsis montana, commonly known as the mountain catopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, where it thrives in cool, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of trichomes, which help retain moisture. Its inflorescence consists of a single, showy flower that can range in color from white to pink. Catopsis montana is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
